alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 9:44AM CST until January 30 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River Near Claiborne Dam affecting Clarke, Monroe and Wilcox Counties. For the Alabama River...including Millers Ferry Dam, Claiborne Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River near Claiborne Dam. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Flooding of pastureland begins along the lower Alabama River. At 40.0 feet, Considerable flooding of agricultural land. At 42.0 feet, Water begins to inundate the Eureka Landing community. At 43.0 feet, Access to Eureka Landing community stops, with access cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Friday the stage was 36.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday afternoon to a crest of 42.7 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 42.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob.
